summary: This bill, the Expanding Access to Mental Health Services in Schools Act of 2025, aims to increase the number of school-based mental health service providers. It authorizes grants to eligible agencies (high-need local educational agencies, educational service agencies, and State educational agencies) to recruit, hire, retain, and diversify these providers. The grants can be used for hiring providers, implementing recruitment and retention strategies (like salary stipends), and providing professional development. The bill also outlines reporting requirements and authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 2026-2030.
